learning_outcomes.description: Contribute to the advancement of relevant scientific fields through original research
Critically evaluate existing research and identify gaps in knowledge relevant to your project

Conduct an independent research project including: documenting project progress, generating appropriate evidence through a reproducible method, objectively analysing data, developing evidence-based arguments to support conclusions, and critically evaluating the impact and limitations your research
Explain your ideas effectively to a general audience by using effective audio-visual means
Report the rationale and findings in a written document

assessments.task_description: Students will provide a presentation on their project in week 8 of their first semester
assessments.submission_guidelines: There is no digital submission. You are required to only present to your supervisor.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This is also referred to as a ‘thesis’. Your report should represent your own original work and clearly identify any research or analysis performed by someone else. The research report could be presented in the form of a scientific manuscript or a longer, ‘traditional’ thesis format. Please discuss the format of your thesis/report with your supervisor. The length of a report/thesis may vary but could range between 4000 words to 8000 words. In exceptional circumstances it may exceed 8000 words – this must be discussed with your supervisors and the Honours Coordinator, and will be dealt with on a case-by-case basis. Work counts will exclude abstract, figure and table captions, references, acknowledgement, or appendices. The report/thesis will be graded by two independent graders.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: A final report (thesis) of the Honours project will be required. The submission deadline is on Friday (2 pm) of Teaching Week 13 of the second (2nd) semester of the Honours year.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Report/thesis submission will be through the Turnitin link on course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The primary supervisor will grade the student's overall performance in consultation with the whole supervisory team (if needed).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Supervisors to submit directly to the Honours Coordinator via email. A grading form will be provided to supervisors.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Contact sessions

In the first semester, three to four contact sessions will be scheduled to check on the progress of your research and explain assignment tasks. Details will be posted on course Blackboard site.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
